author: Teresa Rivas
title: Antarctica Ahoy: 6 Tips on Cruising to the End of the Earth
text: A VISIT TO the coldest, driest, windiest place on earth may not sound like a dream vacation, but for adventurers seeking a family vacation that hasn’t been Facebooked to death—and pining for truly pristine scenery—Antarctica is gaining currency. Some 37,000 tourists set foot on the southernmost continent last year, 8,000 more than a decade earlier. Since, to date, no hotels have opened their doors against the polar gusts, visitors base themselves on a widening range of expedition boats (60-odd and counting), ranging from barely retrofitted research vessels to cushy cruise ships.
